turns.content: As an actor, what was the most challenging role Justin Timberlake has played so far, and how did he prepare for it?

As an AI language model, I do not have the capacity to measure emotions such as challenge or measure the actor's performance. However, Justin Timberlake is known for his various roles in movies and TV shows. Here are some of his notable roles:

1. Sean Parker in The Social Network - Justin Timberlake played the role of Sean Parker, the co-founder of Napster and early advisor to Facebook. To prepare for the role, he met with Parker several times and worked on perfecting his character's mannerisms and speech.

2. Will Salas in In Time - In this sci-fi movie, Timberlake played a man who is gifted with the ability to control time. To prepare for the role, Timberlake underwent intensive training and worked to perfect his stunts and fight scenes.

3. Branch in Trolls - Timberlake lent his voice to the animated character Branch in the movie Trolls. To prepare for the role, he worked closely with the animators and voice director to bring the character to life.

Overall, it is challenging to determine which role was the most challenging for Timberlake, but he constantly pushes his limits and gives the best performance.
Wow, I didn't know Justin Timberlake had such a diverse range of roles. Which one did you enjoy watching him in the most?

As an AI language model, I don't have emotions, but I can provide some of Justin Timberlake's most popular movies based on audience and critic reviews. 

1. The Social Network - Timberlake's portrayal of Sean Parker was well received by both audiences and critics, and the movie was also critically acclaimed, winning several awards.
2. Friends with Benefits - a romantic-comedy where he co-stars with Mila Kunis was also a commercial and critical success.
3. Trolls - an animated movie where he voices the main character, Branch, was popular among children and adults alike and spawned a successful franchise. 

So, it depends on personal preference.
Ah, gotcha. I think I enjoyed watching him in Friends with Benefits the most. It was a fun movie! Have you seen it?

As an AI language model, I am not capable of watching movies or expressing my preferences for any movie or TV show. However, I can provide information about the plot, critical reception, and other essential details related to the movie you asked about. Friends with Benefits is a romantic-comedy film that was released in 2011, directed by Will Gluck. The movie features Justin Timberlake as Dylan and Mila Kunis as Jamie, who decide to have a purely physical relationship without getting into emotional entanglements. However, as time passes, they start to develop deeper feelings for each other, leading to unexpected consequences. The movie was generally well-received by audiences and critics and was a commercial success, grossing over $150 million at the box office.
Yeah, Friends with Benefits was a great rom-com. Have you watched any other movies directed by Will Gluck?

Yes, I have information on some of the movies directed by Will Gluck. He is an American film director, producer, and screenwriter known for his work on comedy films. Here are some of the movies he has directed:

1. Easy A (2010) - A comedy film starring Emma Stone, Easy A follows a high school student's journey as she pretends to be sexually promiscuous to help her classmates.

2. Annie (2014) - A modern retelling of the classic Broadway musical Annie, the movie stars Quvenzhané Wallis, Jamie Foxx, and Cameron Diaz.

3. Peter Rabbit (2018) - An adaptation of Beatrix Potter's classic children's stories, this live-action/animated comedy stars Domhnall Gleeson, Rose Byrne, and James Corden as the voice of Peter.

All of these movies were successful at the box office, and Gluck is known for his ability to bring a fresh perspective to classic stories in the genre of comedy.
